WorkItem.ClosedComment: Already fixed.  Just wait for 2.3.16 (currently planned for wednesday May 12th
WorkItem.Description:
In the Moonkin model, rawr 2.3.15
Â 
I de-selected the epic gem templates, and selected the rare (blue) ones instead.
I have no purple gems selected (aside from Meta, of course) in the individual listings under Comparisons > Gems.
But Optimizer keeps telling me to change all my gemmings to epic gems.

Comments.Message:
Options > Optimizer Settings > Consider gems in enabled gemming templates to be available;
When this option gets unchecked, it no longer suggests purples, but since purples aren't enabled I shouldn't have to uncheck it to fix it.

Same problem here. I don't want rawr to optimize the gemming, so i made one custom template and disabled all the others. I also disabled all gems not in my template in slot:gems.
Now with "Consider gems in enabled gemming templates to be available" enabled (default) the optimizer still uses all gems, like choosing hit gems when I'm below the cap that I made unavailable.
With this option disabled it only considers the gems I choosed, but keeps putting them into other sockets than specified by the template, e.g. red gems into blue sockets.
